Leukocytosis (this is a broad symptom and can be caused by many things, not a diagnosis in itself)
Interstitial cystitis (diagnosis of exclusion, other causes should be ruled out)
Dysgeusia (can be a symptom of many conditions, including nutritional deficiencies, medication side effects, neurological conditions)
Medications (certain medications can cause these symptoms as side effects)
Infections (e.g., Viral infections like Epstein-Barr virus, HIV, Cytomegalovirus, Bacterial infections)
Vitamin or mineral deficiencies (e.g., Vitamin B12 deficiency)
Gastrointestinal disorder (e.g., gastroenteritis, irritable bowel syndrome)
Allergic reaction (e.g., to food, medication, insect sting)
Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) - less likely without more specific symptoms
Appendicitis - less likely without fever or severe pain
Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) - less likely without fever or specific pain
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) - less likely without chronic symptoms
Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) - less likely without heartburn
